features: BE PREPARED IN THE HOME OR ON THE GO: Use Portawipes compressed coin tissues anywhere. Just add a tablespoon of water and you've got a luxurious and hygienic wipe ready to use. In the kitchen, bedroom, bathroom, garage, school or even the workplace. With the INCLUDED FREE WATERPROOF CASE, take them with you everywhere you go. Great for the outdoors, camping, hiking or out on the boat. Great for survival enthusiasts

Includes FIVE Waterproof Cases: Take them with you everywhere you go with the included waterproof storage cases designed for the outdoors, camping, hiking or out on the boat. Great for survival enthusiasts, hunters, and campers!

LARGER, SOFTER AND STRONGER: With a fabric weight of 54 grams per square meter, Portawipes are the THICKEST compressed tissues you can buy! Plus they're up to 27% LARGER than common compressed tissues. Avoid the rough "cheesecloth" texture of common coin tissues. Our unique jacquard fabric is SOFTER on the skin and STRONGER than other brands. Superior to wet naps, wipes or paper towels. It's a difference you can see and feel!

HYPOALLERGENIC, PRESERVATIVE FREE, FRAGRANCE FREE & ODOR FREE: Portawipes compressed coin tissues are made from OEKO-TEX 100 Certified Viscose Rayon derived from cellulose sources and are as pure as the water used to activate them. Soft, gentle and completely ODOR FREE, great for sensitive or delicate skin. Great for kids. Portawipes compressed coin towel wipes won't cause a nasty rash common with the preservatives found in many wet wipes.

REUSABLE: Portawipes can be reused many times. Simply rinse with water and wring out. When you're ready to throw them away, rest assured that Portawipes compressed coin towels will have minimal impact on the environment
body.description: Keep your hands, body, and personal areas cleaner and more hygienic with Portawipes compressed towels designed for the on-the-go lifestyle! Whether you’re an avid camper, love taking your kids to the park, or get a little messy in the garage, you need to keep your hands and personal areas clean, so you can feel comfortable and confident. That’s why we created Portawipes Compressed Towelettes that provide a smart, efficient, and portable way to wipe, clean or wash your hands and body no matter where you’re at! Hypoallergenic, Larger in Size, and Made for Kids and Adults These portable coin towels easily fit in a pocket, backpack, diaper bag, or survival pack, so you always have a clean, odor-free wipe available when you need them most. And because they’re larger in size, softer on even the gentlest skin, and reusable to reduce waste, there’s no adventure you won’t be ready to take on. Order Includes: 50 Compressed Portawipes TowelettesFIVE waterproof travel storage tubes

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 25, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Strong, Absorbent, Soft, Cheap. What’s not to like?
reviews.reviewText: I really wasn’t expecting much from these towels but I had a good experience with some smaller ones and I thought I would give them a try. I only had experience with one other larger towel, and was made of bamboo. So many of the photos will compare this towel with the bamboo towel, but I got to say the only advantage that the bamboo towel has is that it’s about 50% thinner in it’s compressed form. It also comes in at a dollar to $1.50 apiece for the bamboo, versus 35 cents a piece for these.Size: You can see by the picture of the size of the towels before and after decompression. But this towel was quite easy to decompress and required less water than I expected. I was surprised to see that it had a pattern on it of puffy polkadots. These add thickness to the towel and to it’s superior absorbency while minimizing the bulk. The towel expanded to about the promised dimensions of 12“ x 20“ give or take some stretch. And I was pleased to see that this towel has significantly more surface area than the bamboo one so you are gaining something with that added thickness.It’s hard to see exactly how thick the towel is since it has a texture to it but from what I can tell even the non-textured areas are a little bit thicker than the more woven bamboo one. The bamboo towel’s structure seems a bit more spiderweb rather than a tight weave. I tried to do a picture to show the edges and you can see the difference in thickness. I also placed both over a black polkadot pattern to give you an idea of the opacity and thickness of each of the towels.Strength: I allowed the towel to dry and then held it out and put a 5 pound weight on it and then another 5 pound weight and it seem to give no signs of tearing so this thing is strong.Softness: The towel is quite soft feeling, softer than a paper towel or a baby wipe, much more like a tufted cotton or microfiber on the skin. It’s easily soft enough to use On more sensitive parts of the body.Absorbency: This is the real tale of the tape here. I filled two glasses with equal amounts of water and took this towel and the bamboo one, and dunked them in the water. I waited about half a minute for them to fully absorbed and then quickly remove them from the glasses. Well I did not take exact measurements you can see from the photograph that this towel absorbs significantly more water than the bamboo towel. I also performed this experiment with an equal area of premium paper towel that supposedly “feels like cloth“, it may rhyme with diva ;-) and that one absorbed about equal amount of water to the bamboo one, not nearly as good as this towel.So while it is significantly thicker in it’s compressed form, you are gaining a considerable amount of absorbency for that extra thickness and that right there is probably enough to win me over to this towel.The towel seems quite strong and durable and will hold up to multiple uses if not abused. It dries quickly I mean really quickly, and I was able to do an entire sink full of dishes with just this towel to dry them off. ( kind of a clever way to trick me into doing the dishes too)I really liked the bamboo ones and I got used to how thin they are, but these new ones have won me over. I really wish they could be compressed a bit thinner, but I can’t see any reason to take off any stars. It certainly doesn’t hurt that they’re five times cheaper than the ones I’ve been using. These towels perform excellently and deliver exactly what they promise at a surprisingly cheap price.As a bonus, if you take them camping, they easily catch fire from a spark. So once it’s too dirty to continue using, you have a very effective are fire starter.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Must have travel item or parents of little kids
reviews.reviewText: These things are a lifesaver. Great for when there aren't any paper towels available. They are sturdy and surprisingly absorbent even when wet. It doesn't take much water to activate them and I even use them with a spray sanitizer to clean things as well when out and about. The tubes are great to carry them and they are in all of the bags I use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars AMAZING!! little towel
reviews.reviewText: These compressed towels were Amazing. It only took an ounce of water to make them expand full size. I was impressed how large to towelette was once it opened up and how well it stayed together after use. Everyone wanted one and I had more than enough to share. Great value for the price. And, the 10 pk. tube was compact to carry without having to take all 50 at one time; the carrying tube kept them all together, dry and easily accessible when needed.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy Alternative to Wet Wipes for Hiking
reviews.reviewText: I bought these as an alternative to wet wipes to carry on my AT thru hike. They were actually superior to toilet paper due to their strength. Water was practically always in ready supply and I could carry twice as many of these as I could have the pre-moistened wipes.They're really tough and can scrub hard without falling apart. This makes for a great quick "bath" in the evenings at camp. A very small amount of water and it makes a cool face wipe followed by armpits, legs, feet, and maybe a second fresh one for the ol' buttcrack. My primary misgiving is that these are so sturdy that I question their level of biodegradability. They're certainly not falling apart as fast as regular old toilet paper.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for travel!
reviews.reviewText: I used these as a "just-in-case" while traveling. Needless to say, I ended up giving so many of these tabs away because everyone loved them so much. Baby wipes in a tablet form that do not take up much room. Perfection!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars SO Cool, Many Uses
reviews.reviewText: I honestly had no use for these when I bought them, but I like having camping/emergency supplies that can’t expire around the house. I tested one out, and they’re so cool. I wouldn’t use them as a wet wipe necessarily but once they’re “activated” and expanded, they essentially turn into the most durable paper towel/cleaning wipe you could hope to have, whether it’s wilderness or the car or a diaper bag. It also comes with a handy little travel case. Love these things, highly recommend for campers and parents!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for backpacking/camping
reviews.reviewText: I bought these for my backpacking trips as a lightweight way to clean up at the end of a hike and they work great. Why bring a pack of wet wipes that take up a bunch of space when these little tabs will expand quickly with water and do the same thing. They are sturdy wipes, they aren't flimsy or breaking apart as we use them. I put my dirty wipes in a designated doggie bag and packed them out with me. These are a great find, so easy to travel with and use. Just add water and you have a perfect wet wipe..

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewText: We bought these for our “go bag.” Wanted to try one. Even better than we had thought possible! Large, not flimsy, two of us were able to wash our hands with one portawipe!

I gave these as a gift to my sons who are avid fly fisherman and they camp almost every weekend during spring and summer. I kept some for my purse as well as so easy and small to carry. Sons loved them and were surprised at the durability and multi-purpose uses. Pretty much just as ad says... I'll be purchasing again as I can think of many uses because so small to carry and so very handy.
Definitely way better to pack if going on a long trip or going on outdoor adventures. Needing for emergencies, well better safe than sorry I suppose.

reviews.reviewTitle: Compact and many towels at hand
reviews.reviewText: While camping or riding motorcycles size and weight can be a issue but with these towels carrying the 2 tubes is enough for a reasonable trip and then using chilled bottle water nithing better to wipe the sweat and grime away while cooling you down at the sametime.

reviews.reviewTitle: Pas le produit afficher ? (pas la marque demander)
reviews.reviewText: pas la marque correspondence .Recu,Wysi Wipe avec 1 etuis de tranport.AU lieu,de Portawipes avec 2 etuis de transport
Essential product in a compact easily transportable package.
